data.name: AOP - After
data.description:
Aspect-oriented programming (`AOP`) is programming that adds additional behavior (`advice`) to existing functionality without actually modifying that functionality.

Create a method called `adviseAfter`. This method will take three arguments, a function (`target`), the advising function (`advice`), and an optional boolean (`originalArguments`).

`adviseAfter` should return a function that, when executed, will first execute the original method and then the advising function with the following conditions:

* The arguments passed to the function returned by `adviseAfter` should be passed to the original method.
* If `originalArguments` is `true`, the original arguments should be passed to the advising function, otherwise the return value of the original method should be passed as the sole argument to the adivising function.
* The return value of the advising function should be returned.
